profileAlternative.name: John C. Scott
profileAlternative.headline: Global Supply Chain, Sustainability and Procurement Executive
profileAlternative.summary:
A Consumer-industry business leader with a General Manager's view for applying broad and deep supply chain experience to complex challenges; covering strategy development, procurement, CSR/Sustainability, customer logistics, category management, operations, demand/supply planning and the use of collaborative technologies within the consumer goods, hospitality, QSR/restaurant and distribution industries. Able to bridge strategic thought into practical solutions with the ability to roll-up-the-sleeves when needed. Successful in developing high-performance teams that generate creative solutions to drive meaningful bottom-line and top-line improvements. A leader specializing in taking organizations through change or dramatic improvement initiatives.


Demonstrated global operations experience in both Fortune 500 and emerging, high-growth businesses. Successful in developing high-performance teams that generate creative solutions to drive meaningful bottom-line and top-line improvements. Leader and change agent with functional depth and a proven path of developing world class organizations.

Strong natural curiosity and ability to quickly process information supporting unique insights and problem solving skills.

Specialties:
- Supply Chain and Logistics
- Sustainability & Responsible Sourcing
- Strategic Sourcing & Category Management
- Food Safety and Quality
- Financial Acumen and P&L Management
- Strategic Business Planning
- Change Management & Communication
- Merger, Acquisition & Integration Experience
- Organizational Design & Development
- Business Restructuring & Re-engineering
- Technology Roadmaps & Implementation

Achieved accomplishments based on key strengths:
• An unrelenting drive to deliver results
• Leadership with humility
• Optimistic and resilient in face of challenges
• Focus on doing the right thing for business and the team
• Detail-oriented and able to delegate effectively
• Strong problem solving skills

As Chief Procurement Officer / Chief Supply Chain Officer: Accountable for procurement, customer logistics and operations, category management, inventory control, product merchandising/marketing, business & pricing analytics and import/export/contracted logistics departments across 25,000+ products, 1,600+ suppliers covering $825M+ direct spend, $100M+ indirect spend, 700+ operations/supply chain employees within 20+ distribution centers.

positions.title: Global Procurement Director
positions.description:
PepsiCo Positions:
- Global Director of Plastic Bottle/Container Procurement
Led all Global plastic bottle and foods container procurement teams to create a matrixed, BUT UNIFIED, 25+ member team to stimulate productivity, innovation and quality covering nearly $3B+ in spend and 30B+ containers across the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Asia -- resulting in $100M+ in productivity.

- Sr. Director, Gatorade Procurement
Developed a newly created role and team that strategically managed over $1B in business unit procurement spend and tactically controlled over $500M in plastic bottle procurement activity. Was procurement leader for coordination with Gatorade Finance for all packaging & ingredients procurement financials, innovation and procurement operations and business goals.

- Sr. Director, Responsible & Sustainable Sourcing
Initiated the creation of PepsiCo’s strategy for Responsible & Sustainable Sourcing, which addressed procurement’s approach, policy, metrics and goals with suppliers for environmental accountability and corporate social responsibility (CSR). Within our GMA membership, co-chaired inaugural Sustainability Council. Initiated and Co-Chaired AIM-PROGRESS, a collaborative CPG-industry responsible sourcing program and was a board member of Sedex, a not-for-profit technology company supporting best-practices in responsible sourcing for 5+ years.

- Director, Indirect Procurement Strategy & Technologies
Reporting directly to the Chief Procurement Officer, prepared the enterprise for ERP implementation (SAP) by establishing updated P2P business processes to match the use of Indirect and Direct systems
…

positions.title: Management Consulting -- Director, CPG/Retail Supply Chain
positions.description:
Held Project delivery and P&L responsibility for all aspects of program management and client development.

Disciplines included: procurement, supply chain, operations, operational strategy, customer logistics, network optimization, strategic sourcing, business process redesign, technology implementations and business case development.

Key Engagements:
- PepsiCo: Global Indirect Spend Strategy
- PepsiCo: US Logistics Network Optimization
- Heinz: Inventory Management Strategy
- Kraft Foods: Product Availability Modeling
- Wrigley: New Product Innovation Process Improvement
- Seiko: Service Center & Warehousing Network Optimization
- M&M Mars/Masterfoods USA: Supply Chain Visibility Business Case and Technology Roadmap
- Department of Homeland Security (Operation Safe Commerce): Importation Security Streamlining
- Grocery Manufacturers of America (GMA): Associate Membership Council. Chaired committee for the inaugural CPG Excellence Award in recognizing CPG industry leadership, creativity and innovation in supply chain and customer solutions.
…

positions.title: Supply Chain/Operations/Logistics -- Various Positions
positions.description:
- Senior Manager, North America Inventory Management
Managed Supply Chain Deployment and Production Analysts responsible for inventory network flows to support over $3.5B in annual sales across 15+ Manufacturing sites/DCs and 100+ regional branches.

- Senior Manager, Supply Chain Technology & Business Process Transformation
Led the redesign for vendor management processes, internal replenishment of regional DCs, and bakery-direct delivered customers. Managed matrixed staff and consultants to coordinate technical, process, implementation and training requirements for the project, which included the integration of SAP with all supply chain systems, such as Manugistics, Numetrix, etc.

Other Nabisco Positions:
- Supply Chain Analyst (East Hanover, NJ)
- Regional Distribution Center & Customer Logistics Manager (Long Island, NY)
- Territory Sales Manager (Long Island, NY)

All roles were with Nabisco, prior to Kraft/Mondelez's acquisition of the company.

Athlete Training Guide
positions.description:
The mission of Achilles International is to enable people with all types of disabilities to participate in mainstream running events in order to promote personal achievement. As an Athlete Training Guide, we accompany disabled runners during the course of a workout or race, functioning as a member’s eyes, ears, guide, and motivator. including specific support, such as:
- Helping disabled runners become familiar and proficient with special equipment
- Participating in weekly or bi-weekly workouts
- Providing guidance, logistics support and running advice during races and marathon
